intro: Atuna villamilii, commonly known as the Philippine atuna, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers and leathery, elliptical leaves. It typically grows in lowland forests and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
